cname_content.title:
Verify CNAME
CNAME: {{cname}}
cname_content.description: Please go to your domain management website and point your CNAME configuration to above CNAME.
cname_content.help: The CNAME above resolves to Toffs Load Balancer and returns the IP address of ToffsCDN node.
cname_content.pointed_cname_error: Error occurred when checking CNAME pointing.
cname_content.pointed_cname_warning: Your domain's CNAME configuration does not point to this CNAME. Please check.

cache_content.title: Cache configuration
cache_content.description: Accelerate your websites or data delivery by caching the static contents (such as  images, videos, or text files) of your websites.
cache_content.help: By caching an object content, the object content will be stored in ToffsCDN edge. When the user makes a request, ToffsCDN is able to deliver the object content more quickly.

waf_content.title: WAF configuration
waf_content.description: WAF(Web Application Firewall) is a security measure which defines rule sets in order to help protect your web applications by filtering, monitoring and blocking malicious HTTP traffic going through the web applications.
waf_content.help: The WAF examine requests (such as GET and POST) to and from your origin server. Based on the rules that are configured, the firewall will distinguish between legitimate and illegitimate traffic, hence perform necessary action.

ssl_content.title: Generate Free SSL Certificate
ssl_content.description: Please make sure your domain's CNAME configuration pointed to our CNAME, so you can generate SSL certificate.
ssl_content.help: This feature helps you to generate free SSL Certificates. If you don't have your own SSL certificate but you would like to secure your website connection, you may generate an SSL certificate using this feature. Otherwise, you may choose to use your own SSL certificate as well.
ssl_content.pointed_ssl_error: Error occurred when generating SSL certificate.
ssl_content.pointed_ssl_warning: Your domain's CNAME configuration doesn't point to our CNAME, please check.
ssl_content.change_new_ssl_warning: Please point your domain's CNAME configuration to this CNAME, then wait a few minutes and try again later.
ssl_content.free_ssl_content: Click button for generate Free SSL

Verify CNAME

cname_content.help: The CNAME above resolves to Toffs Load Balancer and returns the IP address of ToffsCDN node.

cache_content.title: Cache configuration
cache_content.description: Accelerate your websites or data delivery by caching the static contents (such as  images, videos, or text files) of your websites.
cache_content.help: By caching an object content, the object content will be stored in ToffsCDN edge. When the user makes a request, ToffsCDN can deliver the object content more quickly.

waf_content.title: WAF configuration
waf_content.description: WAF(Web Application Firewall) is a security measure which defines rule sets in order to help protect your web applications by filtering, monitoring and blocking malicious HTTP traffic going through the web applications.
waf_content.help: The WAF examine requests (such as GET and POST) to and from your origin server. Based on the rules that are configured, the firewall will distinguish between legitimate and illegitimate traffic, hence perform necessary action.

ssl_content.title: Generate Free SSL Certificate
ssl_content.description: Please make sure your domain's CNAME configuration pointed to our CNAME, so you can generate SSL certificate.
ssl_content.help: This feature helps you to generate free SSL Certificates. If you don't have your own SSL certificate but you would like to secure your website connection, you may generate an SSL certificate using this feature. Otherwise, you may choose to use your own SSL certificate as well.

page_rule.content_delete_page_rule: Do you want to delete Page Rule?
page_rule.title: Page Rules
page_rule.description: Page Rules trigger certain actions whenever a request matches one of the URL patterns you define. You can define a page rule to trigger one or more actions whenever a certain URL pattern is matched
page_rule.data_invalid: Data between URL and Destination URL is not valid

http2_content.title: HTTP/2
http2_content.help: HTTP/2 is a revision of HTTP network protocol used by the World Wide Web. It reduces latency and page load time by supporting connection multiplexing, while priorities server pushes through providing content to clients without waiting for a request.

websocket_content.title: Websocket
websocket_content.description: Allow WebSockets connections to your origin server.
websocket_content.help: WebSockets are the open connections sustained between the client and the origin server. Inside a WebSockets connection, the client and the origin can pass data back and forth without having to reestablish sessions. This makes exchanging data within a WebSockets connection fast. WebSockets are often used for real-time applications such as live chat and gaming.

api_gateway_config.title: Api Gateway
api_gateway_config.name: Name
api_gateway_config.content_delete_api_gateway: Do you want to delete this API Gateway?

optimization_config.title: Optimization
optimization_config.description: Setup configuration to improve speed of website

minify_content.title: Auto Minify
minify_content.description: Reduce the file size by minifying your files.
minify_content.help: Removes unnecessary characters (such as blanks, newlines, comments, and blocks) from JavaScript, CSS, and HTML files.

compressor_content.title: HTTP Compression
compressor_content.description: Speed up page load times for your visitor’s HTTPS traffic by applying Gzip compression.
compressor_content.help: CDN applies Gzip compression to help speed up page load times for your visitors.

cache_content.title: Cache Configuration
cache_content.description: Accelerate your websites or data delivery by caching the static contents (such as images, videos, or text files) of your websites.
cache_content.help: By caching an object content, the object content will be stored in ToffsCDN edge. When user makes a request, ToffsCDN is able to deliver the object content more quickly.

redirect_config.content_delete_redirection: Do you want to delete Custom Redirection?
redirect_config.list_redirect_description: Create static redirects with advanced features.
redirect_config.title: Redirection

www_redirect_content.title: Domain Flattening
www_redirect_content.description: Redirect all of the requests from root domain to its www version. Eg. From example.com to www.example.com.
www_redirect_content.help: When you have two different addresses pointing to the same page, like www.example.com/index.html and example.com/index.html, many search engines will regard those two URLs as two different pages with duplicate content. To deal with this, you can redirect all pages using one form of the web address ('URL') to the other form. Eg. From example.com to www.example.com.

redirect_content.title: Redirect to Another URL
redirect_content.description: Redirect your URL to another specific URL(HTTP / HTTPS). Eg, http://www.source.com to https://www.destination.com.
redirect_content.help: URL redirection is a technique that takes one website URL and points it to another. When you type in or click on that original URL, you will be taken to the new page or website. Eg. When you open http://www.source.com, you will be redirected to https://www.destination.com.

ssl_config.warning_enable_ssl: Please upload key and crt files or generate to finish turning on SSL
ssl_config.title: Secure Sockets Layer (SSL)

allow_ssl_content.title: Allow HTTPS
allow_ssl_content.description: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is a communication protocol that encrypted HTTP data in transit through a secure connection. Thus, the privacy and integrity of data are maintained, and authentication of websites is also validated.
allow_ssl_content.help:
What does HTTPS do?
HTTPS uses SSL / TLS to encrypt communication over a network. The main function of HTTPS is to provide authentication to the website and protect the privacy and integrity of the exchanged data to prevent eavesdropping and man-in-the-middle attacks.
HTTP URL begins with 'http://' and uses port 80 by default, while HTTPS URL begins with 'https://' and uses port 443 by default.

cookie_content.title: Cookies Setting
cookie_content.description:
Cookies setting allows CDN to override existing cookies.
Turning on HttpOnly feature will disallow Javascript or other applications to access cookies. Only HTTP methods such as POST and GET can get and send cookies.
Turning on Secure Cookie feature enables cookies to be encrypted when transferring cookies from Client to Server.
cookie_content.help: An HTTP cookie (also known as web cookie or browser cookie) is a small piece of data that a server sends to the user's web browser. The browser may store it and send it back with the next request to the same server. Cookies are commonly used in session management, personalization and tracking.

ssl_protocols_content.title: Set TLS Protocols
ssl_protocols_content.description: The minimum TLS version setting specifies the version of TLS a visitor must support in order to connect to your domain using TLS.
ssl_protocols_content.help:
TLS is a cryptographic protocol used to increase security over computer networks.
TLS 1.0 - Released in 1999 and published as RFC 2246.
TLS 1.1 - Released in 2006 and published as RFC 4346.
TLS 1.2 - Released in 2008 and published as RFC 5246.
TLS 1.3 - Released in 2018 and published as RFC 8446.

hsts_content.title: Set HSTS
hsts_content.description: HSTS restricts web browsers to access web servers solely over HTTPS.
hsts_content.help:
Once this feature is enabled, the CDN server will add an additional response header to tell the browser to communicate solely over HTTPS. The response header will look similar to this:
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload.
- max-age defines the time in seconds for which the webserver should only deliver through HTTPS. max-age directive's value should be greater than 10886400 seconds.
- includeSubDomains is optional. This will apply HSTS to all the site’s subdomains as well.
- preload is also optional. By submitting domain through Google HSTS preload service, browsers will never connect to your domain using an insecure connection. (Please note that this is not part of the HSTS specification and should not be treated as official.)
When the HSTS header is present on a website and you access it for the first time over HTTPS, the browser takes note and ensure any future access to http://domain.com will be redirected to https://domain.com until the expiration time run out.
Default status for Set HSTS Per URL is 'ON'. Turning off then on again main HSTS function will restore Set HSTS Per URL status to default status.
hsts_content.invalid_max_age: Please enter a value greater than or equal to 10886400.

upgrade_http_to_https_context.title: Upgrade HTTP to HTTPS
upgrade_http_to_https_context.description: This feature automatically upgrades all insecure resource requests from their pages to secure variants.
upgrade_http_to_https_context.help:
The following header field will be injected into every HTML response that goes out from servers:
Content-Security-Policy: upgrade-insecure-requests
The user agent will treat the following HTML code in the webpage:
< img src=' http://example.com/image.png '>
as though it had been delivered as:
< img src='https://example.com/image.png'>
The URL will be rewritten before the request is made, hence no insecure requests will hit the network.

enable_cipher_content.title: Set Default Cipher
enable_cipher_content.description: A cipher suite is a set of algorithms that help secure a network connection.
enable_cipher_content.help:
The set of algorithms that cipher suites usually contain include:
- a key exchange algorithm - used to exchange a key (to encrypt and decrypt the messages) between two devices.
- a bulk encryption algorithm - used to encrypt the data being sent.
- a message authentication code (MAC) algorithm - provides data integrity checks to ensure that the data sent does not change in transit.

force_https.title: Force HTTPS
force_https.description: Enabling this feature will force all URLs on your site to automatically redirect to the HTTPS version. Eg., if you visited http://example.com/index.html, you will be automatically redirected to https://example.com/index.html.
force_https.help: If your site has secure socket layer certificate (SSL) installed, you can automatically redirect visitors to the secured (HTTPS) version of your site. All contents should load via HTTPS and the site should show as secure.

mutual_authenticate_ssl.title: Mutual Authenticate SSL
mutual_authenticate_ssl.description: Enabling this feature will force all URLs on your site to automatically redirect to the HTTPS version. Eg., if you visited http://example.com/index.html, you will be automatically redirected to https://example.com/index.html.
mutual_authenticate_ssl.help: If your site has secure socket layer certificate (SSL) installed, you can automatically redirect visitors to the secured (HTTPS) version of your site. All contents should load via HTTPS and the site should show as secure.

mutual_authenticate_origin.title: Mutual Authenticate Origin
mutual_authenticate_origin.description: Enabling this feature will force all URLs on your site to automatically redirect to the HTTPS version. Eg., if you visited http://example.com/index.html, you will be automatically redirected to https://example.com/index.html.
mutual_authenticate_origin.help: If your site has secure socket layer certificate (SSL) installed, you can automatically redirect visitors to the secured (HTTPS) version of your site. All contents should load via HTTPS and the site should show as secure.

firewall_config.title: WAF & Security
firewall_config.description: Integrating DDoS protection, Bot Management, CDN and Load Balancing to deliver a highly performance integrated security solution.

capcha_content.title: Captcha
capcha_content.description: By activating Captcha, your site is protected by an extra layer of security.
capcha_content.help: Captcha is a technique used to distinguish between humans and robots. The visitor is shown a word that is recognized by the site. The input given by the visitor is compared with the correct answer. If the answer matches, user is identified as human. Thus given access to the site.

ratelimit_content.title: Rate Limit
ratelimit_content.description: Rate Limiting helps protect against denial-of-service attacks, brute-force login attempts, and other types of abusive behavior targeting the application layer.
ratelimit_content.help: This function is used to limit the number of HTTP requests that users request within a certain period of time. It can slow down brute force password cracking, crawling of web pages, and preventing DDOS attacks. We can use it to limit and filter the standard values of real users and write information such as source URLs into the system log.

cross_origin_content.title: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
cross_origin_content.description:
Enable and set up CORS to allow access from selected domain or source to your website only.
When setting up Access-Control-Allow-Origin header, please leave the input field blank if you would like to allow access from all origins. You may input one or multiple domains using a comma, enter or tab as delimiter. Alternatively, you may copy and paste a list of string domains into input field. It will automatically add multiple tags for the domains.
cross_origin_content.help:
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a mechanism that uses HTTP headers (such as Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *) to instruct a browser to let a web application run at one origin/server, to have permission accessing restricted resources from a different origin/server. When Site A attempts to request content from Site B, Site B may send Access-Control-Allow-Origin header (Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://siteA.com) to inform the browser that the content of this page is accessible by Site A. Site B is inaccessible to origins other than Site A.
Note: Different origin means different domain, protocol, and port than its own origin. If you allow all domains, an empty input is advised.

firewall_config.title_empty: You currently have no Firewall rules. Please click on 'Add' to get started.

header_config.title: Custom Header
header_config.description: Setup configuration to use custom header and information

custom_header_content.title: Host Header
custom_header_content.description: A host header is a third piece of information that you can use in addition to the IP address and port number to uniquely identify a Web domain.
custom_header_content.help: The Host header usually used to specify the domain name of the server and the TCP port that the server is listening to. If no port is specified, the default port of the requested server is automatically used (for example, port 80 is automatically used when requesting an HTTP URL).

custom_header_config.title: Custom Header
custom_header_config.title_empty: You currently have no Custom headers. Please click on 'Add' to begin.

custom_pages_config.title: Custom Pages
custom_pages_config.description: Setup configuration to use custom pages

maintenance_content.title: Maintenance
maintenance_content.help: A maintenance page is a temporary page for times when a site or app needs to be taken offline for updates, backups or maintenance. Visitors will be redirected to maintenance page URL when this feature is turned ON. You may set  to allow visitors from specific IPs to your website.

error_page_content.title: Error Page
error_page_content.description: Instead of using default error page or message which is simple and straightforward, you may set up your own custom error page which includes a more natural description, site's branding, a search form or a page widget.
error_page_content.help: Error pages are server’s response or the result of an HTTP status code returned by servers. Error pages are important to ensure visitors of your site know exactly what’s happening and what they can do when something unexpected happens on your site.

custom_header.content_delete_custom_header: Do you want to delete Custom Header?

network_content.title: network
network_content.description: Manage netowrk setting for your website

http2_content.title: HTTP/2
http2_content.help:
What does HTTP/2 do?

A major revision of the Web’s protocol designed for low-latency transport of content over the World Wide Web.

To improves the way HTTP requests and responses are sent allowing for faster page load times.

websocket_content.title: Websocket
websocket_content.allow_websocket: Allow WebSockets connections to your origin server.
websocket_content.concurrent_connection: Concurrent connection guidelines for your plan: low
websocket_content.help: WebSockets are the open connections sustained between the client and the origin server. Inside a WebSockets connection, the client and the origin can pass data back and forth without having to reestablish sessions. This makes exchanging data within a WebSockets connection fast. WebSockets are often used for real-time applications such as live chat and gaming.

minify_content.help: Removes unnecessary characters (such as blanks, newlines, comments, and blocks) from JavaScript, CSS, and HTML files.

www_redirect_content.title: Redirect to www

www_redirect_content.help: When you have two different addresses pointing to the same page, like www.example.com/index.html and example.com/index.html, many search engines will regard those two URLs as two different pages with duplicate content. To deal with this, you can redirect all pages using one form of the web address ('URL') to the other form. Eg. From example.com to www.example.com.

redirect_content.title: Redirect
redirect_content.help:
What does Redirect do?

Smart routing algorithm uses real-time network intelligence to route traffic through the fastest network paths, while maintaining open, secure connections to eliminate latency imposed by connection-setup.

host_header_content.title: Host Header
host_header_content.help:
What does Host Header do?

Custom nameservers(is this the same as headers?) allow you to create your own, unique nameservers in place of your assigned nameservers.

HTTP URL begins with 'http://' and uses port 80 by default, while HTTPS URL begins with 'https://' and uses port 443 by default.

user_account.name: Name
user_account.2fa_indicator: To use an authenticator app go through the following steps:
user_account.2fa_authenticator_apps: Download a two-factor authenticator app like Microsoft Authenticator for <1>Windows Phone</1>, <2>Android</2> and <3>iOS</3> or Google Authenticator for <4>Android</4> and <5>iOS</5>.
user_account.2fa_scan_qrcode_part1: Scan the QR Code or enter this key
